author: Special Correspondent
text:
Senior leaders of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) and allies of the Left Front took to the streets here on Sunday protesting against the arrest of Jawaharlal Nehru University Students Union leader Kanhaiya Kumar.

While the leaders predominantly targeted the BJP-led Central government, they also criticised the party’s State leadership over raising the pitch for filing a police complaint against Jadavpur University (JU) students who allegedly raised “pro-Afzal Guru slogans” on the campus.

“The arrogance of the RSS and the BJP has reached such a level that they dared to declare in West Bengal that if they were in power, they would drag them [JU students] by the collar out of the campus,” CPI(M) State Secretary Surjya Kanta Mishra said.

“As long as the Left parties and their supporters are here and the red flag is flying high, they [the RSS and the BJP] will never gain any ground in Bengal,” he said.

Other than the CPI(M), supporters and leaders of 12 other parties owing allegiance to the Left participated in the march.
title: Bengal Left leaders take out march on JNU issue
